content.prompt: Which of the following gives the best analysis of the harmony in measure 3, beats 1 and 2 ?

choices.label: A Ⅳ chord with predominant function is between the tonic in measure 2 and the dominant in measure 4.
A ⅳ chord with predominant function is between the tonic in measure 2 and the dominant in measure 4.
A Ⅵ chord prolongs the tonic in measure 2 before moving to the predominant and dominant harmonies that follow.
A ⅵ chord prolongs the tonic in measure 2 before moving to the predominant and dominant harmonies that follow.

unit.text: 5: Harmony and Voice Leading II - Chord Progressions and Predominant Function

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Use symbols and terms to describe melodic, harmonic, and rhythmic relationships in notated music. (This skill is applied in describing these elements in a full musical context.)
